(1, 1, 1): Temporal arteritis, cranial arteritis, Horton disease, senile arteritis, granulomatous arteritis
(2, 0, 2): The arteries of the face and scalp.
(4, 1, 1): Headache, pain over the temples, flu-like symptoms, double vision, difficulty opening the mouth
(5, 1, 1): Blindness, aortic dissection, aortic aneurysm, polymyalgia rheumatica
(7, 1, 1): Inflammation of the small blood vessels within the walls of larger arteries
(8, 1, 1): Based on symptoms and blood tests, confirmed by biopsy of the temporal artery
(12, 1, 1): ~ 1 in 15,000 people a year (> 50 years old)
